nodes.documentation:
@title Source Chain Contract.
This contract provide a way to generate an exit proof. 
Protocol:
1) exitTransaction (asset, burnaddress, hashlock, timelock)
A sender calls this to burn his asset to a burn address which creatas
an transfer proof for a given asset, and returneds a 32 byte transaction recept.
- Transaction is timelocked for a given time.
- A preimage of a secret code hash is added.
2) reclaimTransaction ()
After timelock has expired and if the receiver did not withdraw the asset
the sender can get their asset back with this function.
nodes.name: SourceChain

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

nodes.name: haveContract

entryTransaction(bytes32,bytes32).details: Called by the receiver once they know the preimage of the hashlock. This will transfer ownership of the locked tokens to their address.

params._preimage: sha256(_preimage) should equal the contract hashlock.

exitTransaction(uint256,address,bytes32,.details: Sender sets up the hash timelock burn contract.      * NOTE: sender must first call the approve() function on the token contract.

params._timelock: UNIX epoch seconds time that the lock expires at.       Reclaim can be made after this time.

reclaimTransaction(bytes32,bytes32).details: Called by the receiver once they know the preimage of the hashlock. This will transfer ownership of the locked tokens to their address.

params._preimage: sha256(_preimage) should equal the contract hashlock.
